ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course as taught by Caleb has a large historiographical emphasis, often questioning sources and asking how works might be read as historiographical interventions. We started the semester with Foucault and unsettled a lot of his assumptions as the term progressed. The course covered sex's relation to the state, slavery, and violence, among other topics - the syllabus is quite accurate. In terms of writing, good practice with close reading and analysis of a primary source, and academic book review.
I greatly improved my writing in this course.
How to study and think about the history of sexuality, violence and suppression.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: very kind instructor who cares about the well-being of his students, very manageable reading and writing load, relevant and interesting course readings, seminar is interactive and usually insightful
Weaknesses: as a WR credit, slightly more feedback and emphasis on practicing writing as part of the course itself would have been helpful, though Caleb is always willing to offer feedback if asked!

strengths were the readings and content was very interesting. the professor was amazing and understanding. it could have been improved perhaps by having a clearer finish as to why histories of sexuality is an important study in our modern day.
This course was well organized and taught. Occasionally the seminars felt a bit long, but overall the course was well designed for thoughtful discussion and learning.
The class is incredibly organized and the instructor provides timely feedback. Caleb is great at leading discussion and was great about communicating any changes to the syllabus.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course, especially for the instructor! Maybe not as a WR credit if you're looking for a lot of practice, but it's definitely a class worth taking for the material. I think I have a more critical understanding of both sexuality and the study of history after taking it. And Caleb is great! I would absolutely take another class with him.
I would recommend this course as a great intro into the field of WGSS.

I would recommend this course to another student because the in class discussions were incredibly engaging and rewarding. Considering it was a small class, it felt like you really got to know your classmates as well as Caleb.
